In the coming month the size of this pop is expected to change by:
There is no internal migration from colonial provinces

The number of people that will migrate internally is equal to the size of the pop times the immigration scale ($x$) times the province's immigrant-push modifier ($y$) times the migration factor ($val$)
The nation does not have any colonies
There is no colonial migration from colonial provinces
Rich-strata pops do not migrate colonially
Factory workers do not migrate colonially

The number of people that will migrate colonially is equal to the size of the pop times the immigration scale ($x$) times the province's immigrant-push modifier ($y$) times the province's colonial-migration modifier ($num$) times the colonial migration factor ($val$)
Pops can only emigrate from civilized nations
There is no emigration from colonial provinces
Pops without an ?Yoverseas?! culture do not emigrate

The number of people that will emigrate is equal to the size of the pop times the immigration scale ($x$) times the province's immigrant-push modifier ($y$, squared if it's greater than 100%) times the emigration factor ($val$)
The pop is currently promoting because the promotion factor is greater than the demotion factor
The pop is currently demoting because the demotion factor is greater than the promotion factor
As both factors are negative, the pop is currently neither promoting nor demoting
The number of people that will promote is equal to the size of the pop times the promotion scale ($x$) times the promotion factor ($val$) times your administrative efficiency ($y$)
The number of people that will demote is equal to the size of the pop times the promotion scale ($x$) times the demotion factor ($val$)

Pop growth is proportional to the size of the pop times the sum of:
The quality-of-life factor $x$, which is the product of:
The province factor $x$, which is itself the sum of:
The life rating of the province $x$ minus the minimum life rating $y$, all times $val$
And the base pop growth value $x$
The pop's life needs factor $x$ (life needs satisfaction $y$ - the starvation limit $val$)
Pops of an accepted culture do not assimilate
Pops in colonial provinces do not assimilate
Pops in overseas provinces do not assimilate

0.1 for not having an overseas culture
$x$ from cores present in the province

We accumulate, with all nations, a total of $x$ influence daily.
This is the product of the base influence gain rate ($x$) times our national influence modifier ($y$) times our influence modifier from technology ($val$)
This is divided among the nations we are influencing, resulting in a base daily gain of: $x$
which is further multiplied by 1 plus the sum of the following factors:
$x$ from having one or more of our sphere members as a neighbor
$x$ from not having its capital on the same continent as ours
$x$ from our investment in the nation
$x$ from the size of the target nation

?GWelcome to Project Alice!?W
Project Alice is an emulation (not a simulator!) of your favourite victorian-era video game, in other words, we tweak some mechanics to make it more easier to understand for newer players, while also making the world more dynamic and entertaining, fixing old bugs (such as with crises) and implementing new quality of life features.
?GNew features!?W
?YGlobe?W: ?GLoved?W by many, ?Rhated?W by some, turn it off if it bothers you!
?YTech queue:?W SHIFT-Right click to add technologies to the tech queue! (Right click to unqueue)
?YDomestic investment:?W Instead of investing on individual projects, do it in one go
?YPerformance:?W The ticks per second (not FPS) are atleast, x10 times faster
?YLinter:?W Get coverage errors and warnings in your mods, catch bugs and typos easily
?YMacro builder:?W Build units with varying compositions using our macro builder
?Y11 new mapmodes:?W Religion, fort, employment, etc
?YBuild in entire country:?W SHIFT Right-click to build in the entire country!
?GControls:?W
?YTAB?W: Open chat window
?YESC?W: Open main menu and settings menu
?YTilde (`)?W or ?YTilde (~)?W: Open console
?GEnjoy the game! =^w^=?W
?YLeft-click?W to select or replace\n?YRight-click?W to remove

We can fabricate a casus belli against $country$ with the reason of ?Y$type$?W. This process may take roughly about ?Y$days$?W, and the potential costs from being discovered will give us ?R$badboy$?W infamy.

Enable/Disable AI control of this unit, the unit will:
- Automatically reinforce frontlines
- Automatically siege when it's safe to do so
- Hunt rebels
- Form a defensive position against nations we're likely to attack (this is at the AI's discretion, and only at peace time)
If you want to make this unit target a specific nation or region, first move it close to that region or nation, then turn on AI control - because the AI will override all of your commands until you turn it off again
